#summary This page describes how someone can build augmented reality applications using AndAR.

= License=

The whole project is released under the *GNU General Public License*. This means it can be used in any project that is itself released under the GPL. If you would like to create a commercial application based on AndAR please contact [http://www.artoolworks.com/Home.html ARToolworks].


= Howto =

Note: THIS IS NOT WORKING WITH THE NEW SDK! I'M GOING TO CREATE A LIBRARY PROJECT THOUGH, STAY TUNED!

 * [http://www.eclipse.org/downloads/ Download] and install [http://www.eclipse.org/ Eclipse].(Eclipse IDE for Java Developers)
 * Install the Android Plugin for Eclipse, as described in the [http://developer.android.com/guide/developing/eclipse-adt.html Android docs].
 * Download the Eclipse sample project, [http://andar.googlecode.com/files/AndARSampleProject.zip here].
 * Unzip it somewhere
 * Now start Eclipse.
 * File -> Import
 * General -> Existing projects into workspace
 * Select the unzipped folder
 * enjoy :D
 * Send me an [mailto:tdomhan@gmail.com email], so that I can add you to the [ProjectsUsingAndAR http://code.google.com/p/andar/wiki/ProjectsUsingAndAR] wiki page.
